intro: Tridactyle laurentii var. laurentii, commonly known as the Laurentian tridactyle, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
